title: SAP SuccessFactors and Cloud Solutions Consultant
travelRequired: Up to 100% or 5 days a week (home on weekends - based on project requirements)
description:
"We are seeking experienced talent to fulfill roles in our rapidly expanding SAP Practice, for engagements with leading clients in Sri Lanka and in the region.

1. SAP SucessFactors
2. SAP Cloud For Customer (C4C)
3. SAP Hybris

The Consultant will work in collaboration with Clients and Global IBM Subject Matter Experts to help Clients envision their future and/or create test and validate hypotheses to identify the root causes of business challenges or help align business and technology to create new possibilities, using appropriate analysis techniques and frameworks. Identify innovative approaches to address the challenges and implement integrated business solutions that create and enable rapid growth and sustainable value.

Required:
• A proven track record in conceptualizing and implementing business solutions in one of the focus areas.
• A proven track record in leading pre-sales engagements.
• Understanding of industry trends, technology trends and regulatory changes in industry.
• 1 year or more of experience in one of the focus areas with one full life cycle implementation experience, would be an advantage.
• Degree level or equivalent educational qualification.
• Masters or any specific SAP certification will be an added advantage.
• Excellent verbal and written communication skills."

title: Event Manager, GBS Learning & Knowledge Europe
travelRequired: Up to 25% or 2 days a week (home on weekends- based on project requirements)
description:
Event Manager provides logistical and co-ordination support for a selection of GBS training courses and events across Europe.
Is serving as a reliable source of information about GBS L&K training courses and associated policies and procedures. Event Manager is responsible for building  and maintaining close links with Learning Consultants, Education Managers, L&K Staff and Tutors, IBM Learning, external vendors and suppliers, providing up to date information and assistance.

Key responsibilities:
- Liaise with the Education Managers Team to forward scheduling plans and to contribute to the preparation of the event management documents (Briefs for budget approval),
- Set up course events as Offerings on Talent@IBM, controlling and monitoring participant enrolments and following correct approval processes for a selection of courses.
- External and internal venue sourcing (following budget guidelines), with possible need for on-site visits.
-  Provide advice to potential participants re courses and material available.
- Responding effectively and timely to telephone/mails enquiries related to training within GBS.
- Processing and raising carts / purchase other requests.
- Liaising with stakeholders, Education Managers and tutors to ensure smooth running of each event and provide information on course attendance.
- Understanding / adhering to and communicating L&K training and financial policies.
- Data management – ensuring data quality and integrity in the Event Management Briefs / Event Management Tool, evaluation process is adhered to and providing accurate attendee data
                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                     
Technical know-how & qualifications :
• English - Fluent,  Fluent in Italian, French or German is an advantage
• Interest and ability in the application of information technology
• Ability to type fast and accurately
• Proficiency in MS Office programs (Excel expertise is required)
• Proficiency in Lotus Notes / Verse applications is desirable
• Broad understanding of Education Delivery

title: Marketing Manager (Service line)
travelRequired: Up to 25% or 2 days a week (home on weekends- based on project requirements)
description:
> Responsible for market management of the Service Marketing and be accountable for the corresponding business results;
> Identify and define attractive and addressable market segments for the assigned areas
> Develop and validate strategic priorities and recommendations to capture market opportunities and drive business performance in the defined market segments
> Apply portfolio, segment & buyer expertise to create a uniquely service PoV & orchestrate the development of the Segment Marketing Plan
> Collaborate with Market Intelligence Team to capture customer’s and partner’s feedback to enhance market understandings work proactively with the extended IBM teams to reach out to the relevant IT & Line of-Business audience groups, drive market awareness, generate interests and create demands
> Develop/Localize sales and business partner enablement content marketing messages, offerings and collaterals
> Be the trusted advisor to the corresponding business leaders.  
> Overall owner of the healthiness of business pipeline including pipeline generation by all relevant channels as well as actions to drive pipeline progression
> Manage current quarter execution of actions to drive segment business results & provide guidance to the extended marketing team to develop and execute effective marketing campaigns to drive business pipeline build-up of future quarte

 Required Skills:
> Bachelor's Degree or above
> Good communications skill internally and externally
> Strategic and creative thinking
> Ability to work effectively in a matrix environment
> Excellent listening, oral and writing skills
> Fluent in Mandarin and English languages
Preferred Skills:
> Knowledge of relevant service marketing
> Experience in B2B marketing and MNC company is a plus

title: System Database Administrator
travelRequired: Up to 10% or 1 day a week
description:
JOB DESCRIPTION
 
          IT Specialists who apply their technical skills to support the operation and maintenance of vendor products, services, and solutions.  Individuals who are part of support typically have responsibility for sizing, troubleshooting, and critical customer situations. Renders advice and counsel to clients regarding database administration.  understands database administration and can make recommend actions that may be considered to resolve the client's problems or issues within  this area.  Has direct client experience with database administration.
 
  •           Database tuning and performance monitoring.
  •           Support for daily operations.
  •           Database maintenance, installation and configuration.
  •           Provide support for critical problems on online systems.
  •           Setup and maintain documentation and standards.
  •           Monitoring the databases.
  •           Support for new projects and technical process.
  •           Mainly activities on Oracle and MS-Sql databases.
 
QUALIFICATIONS
 
  •          Planning and managing resources to provide correct levels of support.
  •          Strong technical skills related to analyze and solve problems.
  •          Good communication skills in English.
  •          Team player.
  •          Experience in OS environment WINDOWS/UNIX/LINUX operating systems.
  •           Experience with Shell scripting. 

EXPERIENCE
 
  •           Worked as an Oracle and MS-SQL Database Administrator.
  •           Worked in a complex environment.
 
TECHNICAL SKILLS
             
  •           Planning and implementing of databases backup and restore activities.
  •           Designing and creating new databases.
  •             Plan and implement physical DBMS performance improvements (i.e. resize logs, modify.
  •           Maintain database security.
  •           Implement and manage MS-SQL logshipping, Database Control, Clustering.
  •           Experienced on RAC (Real Application Cluster).
  •           Experienced on Exadata Systems. (Cell config, Patching, Linux knowledges).
  •             Experienced on diagnostic tools such as AWR, alert.log, OS logs (wait events, backround processes, memory architectures etc).  
  •             Provide 24x7 DBMS support for production servers or as required by SLA.
  •           Perform database monitoring using agreed upon enterprise level tool.
  •           Implement and manage ASM, RAC, Data Guard, Database Control, Partitioning, Clustering.
  •           Maintain DBMS tools and processes for monitoring and managing the Databases.
  •           Physical and logical planning of databases.
  •           Able to plan and implement database data loads/exports/imports process.
  •           Installation and configuration of Oracle DB, ASM, RAC software.

title: Batching processing specialist
requiredSkills:
2+ years Windows/Linux batch monitoring           
3+years in problem determination, escalation and resolution; Incident and Service Request handling              
3+ years in batch processing and console monitoring
description:
This role is responsible for monitoring, controlling and operating complex computer systems, networks, applications and/or distributed systems in a multi vendor environment. They are also responsible for analyzing deep problems for all systems (according to the service agreements), resolving and routing as appropriate, supporting the Systems Management Processes specific to their client requirements, performing monitoring duties where appropriate and batch management when required.
 
Roles and Responsibilities:
    Windows/Linux Console Operations,
    Batch Operations,
    Batch Monitoring tools - Preferrable Control M
    Monitor operation of computer system including all peripheral equipment to identify potential problems on a 24x7 operation.
    Prepare incident reports for proper documentation and resolution.
    Execute batch processing and initiate correction action to meet online target.
    Execute BCP/DR procedures.

title: Field Marketing Coordinator (New York) - Bluewolf
requiredSkills:
• BA/BS degree
  • 2-3 years of event production, event marketing or a related field
  • Detail-oriented with organizational skills – able to juggle multiple things at once
  • Ability to manage budgets
  • Enjoys working in a fast – paced environment
  • Experience with CRM databases like Salesforce, as well as marketing automation tools like Eloqua, Marketo, Pardot, a plus
travelRequired: Up to 10% or 1 day a week
description:
As a Field Marketing Coordinator, you will be a valuable player on the team that brings Bluewolf, an IBM Company's company vision to life at industry trade shows, hosted customer events, partnership programs and more. From strategizing marketing initiatives to launch, from promoting the event's program to sourcing venues, vendors, and budget tracking -- you will wear many hats. You will also assist in executing memorable programs and events across the U.S. from start to finish.

 

Key Responsibilities:

  • Creatively plan, develop, and execute targeted field marketing and event campaigns, including managing timelines and logistics for both hosted and sponsored events
  • Develop a network of event contractors, venue identification, printing and design of materials
  • Manage inventory and shipments of collateral and swag for East Coast events
  • Partner with our social and PR teams to identify opportunities to generate press and social media content to promote events programs, ensuring messaging and goals are achieved at events
  • Develop and improve event processes and strategies, collecting input from cross-functional teams
  • Track and gather results from each event in a timely manner and incorporate key learning in event recaps to develop successful future events
  • On-site at live events, have an enthusiastic and effective presence, while being a brand ambassador to create a positive attendee experience
  • Coordinate project management of deliverables across internal marketing teams

title: Watson Health - Design Assurance Engineer
role: Product Safety & HW Compliance Engineering Prof
requiredSkills: • At least 5 years of work experience in a healthcare device or life sciences pharmaceutical company
preferredSkills:
•  5 years of work experience in a healthcare device or life sciences pharmaceutical company
  • 2 years of quality assurance compliance work experience in a regulated SW development company, preferably in a cloud or mobile platform industry segment
travelRequired: Up to 10% or 1 day a week
description:
***New hires can join in  a Watson Health strategic location.  Raleigh, NC, Cambridge, MA, North Castle, NY and Yorktown Heights NY  are preferred.

It’s time to transform health with new ways of working to improve approaches to care, productivity and well-being. Watson Health’s cognitive systems understand, reason and learn – helping to translate information into knowledge that can help drive more informed decision-making.  With cognitive computing, we can see and analyze more data than ever before – and achieve more than we ever thought possible.

As a Design Quality Assurance Engineer and member of the Watson Health Compliance Organization you will work in a multi-disciplinary group, contributing to the design and development of Software Systems and verification processes for the development of Class I, II and III medical devices, including new product development and maintenance of released product.  You will use your knowledge of FDA Pharmaceutical and Medical Device compliance regulations and international standards to provide design quality assurance support for Clients, Project Leaders, Development, Operations, and other cross-functional team members and personnel. You will support post market surveillance processes for Watson Health. This will include participation in resolving CAPAs, complaints, MDRs, recalls, serving and non-conforming products. You will interface with the Business and Marketing leaders, the solution reams, compliance organization, the legal department and other stakeholders to maintain compliance of Watson Health Offerings.

You will be responsible for:
  • Providing design quality assurance support in the development of medical device products, and facilitating the application of design controls and V&V system/software validation.
  • Providing design assurance support for post market surveillance processes when design changes are required.
  • Ensuring development activities are planned, documented, and executed to satisfy regulatory, customer and designated internal requirements.
  • Ensuring development is compliant with internal and external standards
  • Actively supporting product development projects by coaching teams to create Project Development Plans,  Design Inputs and Outputs, Design History Files, Risk Management, Test strategy, Verification and Validation plans, Test Traceability, etc.
  • Participating in product risk assessment efforts, including hazard analysis and design failure mode effect analysis
  • Reviewing and approving design verification and validation test plans, protocols and reports.
  • Ensuring changes to existing products are conducted in compliance with the FDA Quality System Regulation, ISO 13485 Regulations, and other applicable standards.
  • Participating in continuous improvement of design control process and project management planning
 
 
Ideally, you will be:
  • Current in knowledge of applicable federal and state healthcare regulations, laws and accreditation standards
  • Experienced in compliance laws and regulations, access, release of information, and release control technologies including 21 CFR 820, 21 CFR 803, 21 CFR 806, ISO 13485, ISO 14971, IEC  62304 and the Medical Device Directive
  • Knowledgeable of verification and validation in a regulated industry
  • Skilled in requirements analysis, including testable and measurable specifications
  • Experienced with standards for the design, verification, and validation of medical device products


Join us and be part of a diverse and global team of thinkers and doers — people who want to make an impact, cultivate their expertise and collaborate with some of the world’s top business and technology professionals.
